#Text=Sevenoaks
#Text=Sevenoaks is a town in Kent , in the South East of England .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Sevenoaks is a fairly traditional market town , although these days , given its proximity to London , it is known largely as a commuter town .

#Text=Contrary to popular belief the town is n't named after the seven oak trees that stood alongside the cricket pitch ( six of which were destroyed in the great storm of 1987 ) ; the town 's name is instead derived from the Saxon word seouenaca , the name given to a small chapel in Knole Park around 800 AD .
#Text=The district of Sevenoaks consists of 29 villages and small towns including of Chiddingstone , Edenbridge and Hever .
#Text=Otford is a quintessential village , nestled in the Kent countryside .
#Text=It was mentioned in the Domesday book and was the site of an old Saxon battle .
#Text=It is the perfect place to explore the Darenth Valley , especially if you like gentle country walks with plenty of rustic pubs along the way .
#Text=By car
#Text=Sevenoaks is very near the junction where the M26 meets the M25 .
#Text=The M26 ( or A25 ) leads to Maidstone , and the A21 heads south to Tonbridge , Tunbridge Wells and Hastings .
#Text=By train
#Text=is fairly near the centre of town , to the north .
#Text=It is on the Main Kent Coast Line , which runs from London Charing Cross to Hastings .
#Text=London is 20-30 minutes away , depending on whether the train is direct or a stopper service .
#Text=Trains also run on First Capital Connect to Bedford , Luton and St Albans .
#Text=is a 5 – 10 minute walk from the village centre .
#Text=Be careful not to let train sales staff confuse the place with Oxford .
#Text=There are regular trains from London Victoria as Otford lies on the main Ashford and Maidstone lines .
#Text=The ticket office is often closed , but there is a side gate to let you onto the platform .
#Text=There is a bike shed and a large carpark at the station , which gets busy during the week as many residents commute into London .
#Text=is the main train station in West Kent ; any destination other than those on the London – Hastings mainline will require a change here .
#Text=It is 10 minutes by train from Sevenoaks .
#Text=Fare and timetable information is available from South East Trains or by telephoning +44 8457 484950 ( premium number ) .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Sevenoaks is not a large town , and the centre can easily be travelled on foot .
#Text=As with most other towns in England , the town is well serviced by buses and taxis .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Arriva is the bus company that operates in Sevenoaks .
#Text=Timetables and fares are available on their website .
#Text=Buy your ticket from the driver when you board the bus .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=The main taxi rank is at the train station , although you can order a taxi by telephone to pick you up from anywhere .
#Text=For pre-booked journeys , try :
#Text=Streamline , ☏ +441732459990 .
#Text=iPhone App and Textbooker available .
#Text=Space Travel .
#Text=MS Executive Chauffeurs , ☏ +441892513042 , toll-free : 0800 980 7252 .
#Text=Kent Chauffeurs .
#Text=See
#Text=Knole House , TN15 0RP , ☏ +441732462100 , ✉ knole@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Mar-Oct : daily 11AM-5PM ( bookshop , cafe and carpark open at 10AM ) ; Nov-Feb : showrooms closed , cafe and shop remain open ; park us open year-round from dawn to dusk .
#Text=One of the great treasure houses of England , set in a magnificent deer park .
#Text=Built in the 15th century and altered only in 1603 , it has remained untouched since .
#Text=Whole property : adult £15 , child £7.50 ; gatehouse only : £5/2.50 .
#Text=Sevenoaks Museum and Art Gallery , Buckhurst Lane , ☏ +441732 453118-452384 .
#Text=Lullingstone Roman Villa , Lullingstone Lane , Eynsford , DA4 0JA ( 8 miles north of Sevenoaks ) , ☏ +441322863467 .
#Text=Adults £6.20 , children £3.70 , concessions £5.60 .
#Text=Quebec House , Quebec Square , Westerham , TN16 1TD ( 6 miles west of Sevenoaks ) , ☏ +441959567430 , ✉ quebechouse@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Ightham Mote , Mote Road , Ivy Hatch , Sevenoaks , TN15 0NT ( 6 miles east of Sevenoaks ) , ☏ +441732810378 , ✉ ighthammote@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Emmetts Garden , Ide Hill , Sevenoaks , TN14 6BA ( 5 miles west of Sevenoaks ) , ☏ +441732868381 , ✉ emmetts@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Chartwell , Mapleton Road , Westerham , TN16 1PS ( 7 miles west of Sevenoaks ) , ☏ +441732868381 , ✉ chartwell@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=Most parts daily 10AM-5PM , house opens at 11AM or 11:30AM ; house rid closed Nov-Feb .
#Text=Family home of Sir Winston Churchill , with magnificent views over the Weald of Kent .
#Text=Car park ( for countryside access ) open daily 8AM-5PM .
#Text=Adult £15.50 , child £7.75 ; garden and studio only £9/£4.50 .
#Text=Bough Beech reservoir .
#Text=for walking , sailing and fishing .
#Text=Includes a wildlife reserve
#Text=Hever Castle , Hever , near Edenbridge , ☏ +441732861710 .
#Text=Mar : W - Su grounds 10:30AM-4:30PM , house noon-4:30PM ( last entry 3PM ) ; Apr-Oct : daily grounds 10:30AM-6PM , house noon-6PM ( last entry 4:30PM ) ; Nov-Feb : hour vary - consult website .
#Text=A 13th-century castle once home to Anne Boleyn .
#Text=Superb example of a Tudor manor house with plenty of history related to Henry VIII .
#Text=Well maintained landscaped Italian style garden restored by William Waldorf Astor in the early 1900s .
#Text=There are also special events from March to October .
#Text=Castle & garden : adult £16.75 , senior or student £14.75 , child £9.40 ; garden only : adult £14.50 , senior or student £12.75 , child £8.90 .
#Text=Chiddingstone Village .
#Text=It is described as being the most perfect surviving example of a Tudor village in the United Kingdom .
#Text=Much of the village is owned by The National Trust .

#Text=The Chiding Stone from which the village derives it 's name is a large sandstone rock formation , and tradition asserts that the stone was used as a seat of judgement , mainly to remonstrate overbearing local wives .
#Text=Church of St. Mary 's , Chiddingstone .
#Text=This parish church is a beautiful Grade II* listed sandstone church and is , perhaps , the fourth built on the site .

#Text=In the churchyard is a mausoleum dating from 1736 built by Henry Streatfeild ; leading down into the family vault beneath which has a through flow of air provided by vents in two false altar tombs .
#Text=The church was almost destroyed by a lightning fire in 1624 .
#Text=Chiddingstone Castle .
#Text=Open to the public and houses Buddhist , Egyptian and Japanese artefact collections - the Japanese collection is exceptionally fine .
#Text=The house dates back to the early 1500s , owned by the Streatfeild family and in the early 1800s was Gothicised by Henry Streatfeild with a new ashlar castellated exterior .
#Text=The castle was sold to Lord Astor in 1938 , and then served as a base for military forces during the Second World War .
#Text=It then became Long Dene school until 1954 when the school was closed .

#Text=The collections were assembled at startlingly low cost by Denys Eyre Bower , who bought the Castle with a bank loan , and was subsequently imprisoned on an absurd charge of attempting to murder his fiancee , who claimed Italian nobility but was in fact from Balham .
#Text=The extraordinary story is told by Mary Eldridge in her book " Beyond Belief " .
